## Bakewell tart `r vegan`

:::: {.columns}

::: {.column width="80%"}

Pastry: \
250g P flour \
40g icing sugar \
1/4tsp salt \
150g butter

Filling: \
80g melted butter \
130g sugar \
60g P flour \
10g cornflour \
90ml [aquafaba](#sec-aquafaba) \
200g ground almonds \
1tsp BP \
1/2tsp almond extract \
6tbsp raspberry jam 

Topping: \
150g raspberries \
flaked almonds

:::

::: {.column width="20%"}

180° \
23-25cm tart

:::

::::

*Method*

1. Shape pastry into disc and chill half an hour.
1. Roll and line tart.
1. Prick and freeze 20mins.
1. Bake with beans 20mins, then without 10mins until pale golden then set aside.
1. Whisk melted butter and sugar, then whisk in flours.
1. Gradually whisk in [aquafaba](#sec-aquafaba), then rest of frangipane.
1. Assemble and bake 30-45mins.

##  Chocolate caramels `r freezes` `r vegan`

:::: {.columns}

::: {.column width="80%"}

100g dark brown sugar \
2tbsp water \
2tbsp tahini or nut butter \
2tbsp coconut oil or vegan butter \
1/4 tsp fine sea salt \
1/2 tsp vanilla \
300g dark chocolate

:::

::: {.column width="20%"}

35 ice cubes

:::

::::

*Method*

1. Heat sugar and water until dissolved and starting to bubble - swirl if necessary - 2-3 mins max.
1. Remove from heat and add oil, tahini, salt and vanilla and stir.
1. Heat very low for 30 seconds if won't come together.
1. Cool - will be very runny at first, but will thicken as cools.
1. Once cool, line moulds with 3mm chocolate and leave couple of mins.
1. Then fill with cool caramel and top with 2-3mm chocolate.
1. After 30 mins in freezer, can demould.

*Notes*

- Thought the tahini was quite strong, but were liked by others. Maybe peanut butter would be nice?

## Chocolate fudge `r vegan`

350g dark chocolate \
370g vegan condensed milk \
chopped nuts to decorate

:::

::: {.column width="20%"}

:::

::::

*Method*

1. Melt over low heat, stirring occasionally until smooth and silky.

## Chocolate pudding `r vegan`

:::: {.columns}

::: {.column width="80%"}

65g sugar \
2tbsp cocoa \
1.5tbsp cornstarch \
295ml milk \
15g butter \
0.5tsp vanilla

:::

::: {.column width="20%"}

3 dessert pots

:::

::::

*Method*

1. Whisk sugar, cocoa and cornstarch until no lumps in a pan.
1. Add milk and combine.
1. Heat to simmer and whisk often.
1. Simmer about 3 mins until slightly thickened and glossy.
1. Remove from heat and whisk in butter and vanilla.
1. Pour into dishes and chill overnight.

*Notes*

- Will thicken as it cools.
- Unsure about this recipe - was ok, but texture a bit odd.

## Chocolate tart `r vegan`

:::: {.columns}

::: {.column width="80%"}

Base: \
350g digestives \
2tbsp cocoa \
1tbsp P flour \
1tbsp syrup \
125g-175g butter

Filling: \
2 x 400g cans coconut milk, chilled \
200g dark chocolate \
1tbsp syrup

:::

::: {.column width="20%"}

180° \
10-12mins \
23cm tart

:::

::::

*Method*

1. Crush biscuits, mix in rest and enough butter to create dough.
1. Press into tin, bake and cool.
1. Whisk melted chocolate, syrup and only thick coconut (discard water).
1. Pour over base and set in fridge for 3-4 hours.

*Notes*

- Kept in fridge for few days.
- Nice with raspberries.

## Rolos 

:::: {.columns}

::: {.column width="80%"}

150g chocolate \
100g granulated sugar \
65ml double cream \
40g butter

:::

::: {.column width="20%"}

12 ice cube size

:::

::::

*Method*

1. Melt 2/3 chocolate over pan of hot water.
1. Line molds with chocolate and chill.
1. Cook sugar with minimal stirring over low-med flame until fluid and amber.
1. Add butter and combine.
1. Pour in cream, stir for a minute or two, remove from heat to cool (can add pinch salt if desired).
1. Once caramel is cooled assemble and chill.

*Notes*

- Called them 'Blockos' because they were big - used ice tray, because don't have a mold.

## Sticky toffee pudding `r vegan`

:::: {.columns}

::: {.column width="80%"}

120ml water \
200g dates \
110g butter \
110g light brown sugar \
200g SR flour \
1tsp B of S \
1tbsp ginger \
2tsp mixed spice \
1tsp cinnamon \
240ml milk \
1tbsp [apple cider vinegar](#sec-other) 

Sauce: \
3tbsp syrup \
200g light brown sugar \
150g butter \
1tsp vanilla

:::

::: {.column width="20%"}

170° \
50mins \
1 litre dish

:::

::::

*Method*

1. Simmer dates in water for 5mins.
1. Cream butter and sugar.
1. Add vinegar very very last.
1. Melt sauce ingredients and simmer 5m.
1. Prick, pour over 1/2 sauce. Rest to serve.
